name: Flupentixol (Depixol)
summary: A typical antipsychotic of the thioxanthene class used in schizophrenia, other psychoses, and in some countries at low doses for depression and anxiety.
description: Flupentixol is a first-generation (typical) antipsychotic of the thioxanthene group. It primarily blocks dopamine D2 receptors in the mesolimbic pathway, reducing psychotic symptoms. At lower doses, it has antidepressant and anxiolytic properties. Available in oral and long-acting injectable formulations.

contraindications: Known hypersensitivity to flupentixol or other thioxanthenes

items: Low-dose use for depression and anxiety (outside US)

sections.text: Blocks dopamine D2 receptors in mesolimbic pathways, reducing positive psychotic symptoms; also antagonizes serotonin and adrenergic receptors to a lesser degree.

adult.oral_psychosis: 3–15 mg/day in divided doses; maintenance: 3–6 mg/day
adult.depot: 20–40 mg IM every 2–4 weeks; adjust by response

sections.renal_impairment: No specific adjustment, but use caution

sections.text: Oral: improvement within days to weeks; depot: onset in 24–72 hours, duration up to 4 weeks.

sections.black_box: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis.
other: Risk of extrapyramidal symptoms increases with dose
Monitor for tardive dyskinesia with long-term use

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; use caution

sections.text: Gradually reduce over weeks to months to prevent withdrawal dyskinesia or relapse.

items: Depot formulation improves adherence in chronic psychosis
Low-dose use for depression is not FDA-approved but used in some countries
Thioxanthenes have similar profile to high-potency typical antipsychotics
